item.description:
Are you preparing the JLPT? But you are not sure how to make a study schedule?

Studying with others in a small group is helpful to everyone because you can:
- Think out loud
- Share ideas
- Learn from one another
- Support each other
... and more!

• How many?
5-10 people

• Who?
Anyone who is interested in taking the JLPT.

• Where?
The Coop Cafe at Harvard Sq. (Please find us on the 2nd floor.)
(If the group gets bigger, I will find another place to host it.)

• How long?
2 hours

• When?
Saturday morning from 10 to 12. (brunch will follow)

Getting the Most Out of a Study Group Session
Here are some tips to help you get the most out of each study session:
• State your goals
• Be prepared
• Take turns teaching
• Stay on topic

By supplementing your individual study with a study group, you can reinforce what you've learned, deepen your understanding of complex concepts, and maybe even make a few new friends. Who said learning can't be fun?

If you have any questions or suggestions, please do not hesitate to send me a message.
item.how_to_find_us: We will be on the 2nd floor.
item.name: The Saturday JLPT Study Group
